name: Blizzard Mo'PaQ File
summary: Learn about .MPQ files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: Mike O'Brien developed the Mo'PaQ (short for Mike O'Brien Pack) archive format for use in Blizzard Entertainment games. Some examples of Blizzard video games that use the format include:
Diablo II + Lord of Destruction expansion pack
Warcraft III + Frozen Throne expansion pack
World of Warcraft + expansion packs (Burning Crusade, Wrath of the Lich King, Cataclysm, etc.)
MPQ archives may store various types of files:

description: A file with .mpq extension mainly belongs to Blizzard Game by Blizzard Entertainment. The main specifications of any MPQ files are compressed graphics, sounds, level data, etc. If we talk about MPQ archives, these were first familiarized with the game Diablo and now very much popular in numerous games. The MPQ file is a big binary source container for level maps, and item mockups, music plus video, etc.

An MPQ file is a game data archive used by Blizzard Entertainment video games, such as Diablo and World of Warcraft. It contains level data, graphics, videos, and sounds for a specific Blizzard game in the Mo'PaQ (MPQ) format. MPQ files may be compressed, encrypted, or segmented into multiple files.

instructions: MPQ files are not meant to be opened. Instead, the Blizzard Entertainment-developed game it is packaged with references the data in the file and loads it.

If you want to view and modify the data in an MPQ file, you may use one of several utilities, including MPQ Editor and StormLib Library. Please note that modifying MPQ files is not supported by Blizzard Entertainment and may corrupt the files.
